text: what's at stake here is a simple
question we are already in this fight we
didn't choose to be in it but we're
already in it the question now is
whether we are going to take the fight
to them in their headquarters or whether
we're going to wait here in London until
they bring the fight to us as they did
to our French colleagues in Paris we are
able under the United Nations Charter
both in self defense of the United
Kingdom and in the collective
self-defense of Iraq we are able able to
take action against ISIL in Syria and
that position has been underlined by the
United Nations Security resolution 20 to
49 which was passed in the wake of the
Paris bombing calling on all member
states of the United Nations to take all
necessary measures to prevent ISIL from
carrying out terrorist atrocities that's
what we would be doing if we take this
action but what we are proposing here is
to bring to bear a high-precision
capability which will actually allow us
to prosecute this campaign with less
risk of civilian casualties than the
bombing that some other partners and
allies are doing we will be able to use
these very high precision RAF weapons
with very small charges to take out
individual vehicles individual
apartments individual rooms in
apartments in a way that allows us to
target the leadership figures to target
the key infrastructure of ISIL without
placing the civilian population at undue
risk
